step1.title: Confirm eligibility and ability to attend
step1.canAttendSubtitle: I can attend the conversation on
step1.eligibleText: I am 16 years old or over, I live in the UK, I live at an address that received an invitation and I am not an elected representative of any level of government, a paid employee of a political party, a Council employee working in a politically restricted role or a journalist (although if you are interested in attending in an observational capacity, please get in touch)

step2.title: Name, contact details and address
step2.description: We use the following contact details in order to communicate with you about this event.
step2.emailNote: Every person who registers online must have their own individual email address. If you do not have an email address, or you share one with someone else who is registering, please ring the Freephone number above to register.

step3.title: About You
step3.description: We use the following details in our democratic lottery process, to select a group of participants that broadly represents the entire community.
step3.genderQuestion: What gender do you identify as?
step3.birthDateQuestion: What is your date of birth?
step3.ethnicityBlack: Black, African, Caribbean or Black British
step3.ethnicityWhiteBritish: White English, Welsh, Scottish, Northern Irish or British
step3.healthQuestion: Do you have any physical or mental health conditions or illnesses lasting or expected to last 12 months or more which limit your ability to carry out day-to-day activities?
step3.nhsSatisfactionQuestion: All in all, how satisfied or dissatisfied would you say you are with the way in which the National Health Service runs nowadays?
step3.educationQuestion: What is your highest educational qualification?
step3.educationNoneDesc: You have none of the qualifications (or none yet) listed below.
step3.educationLevel1Desc: Up to 4 GCSEs grade A* to C, any GCSEs at other grades, 1 AS level, NVQ level 1.
step3.educationLevel2Desc: 5 or more GCSEs (A* to C), O levels (passes) or CSEs (1 A level, 2 to 3 AS levels, Welsh Baccalaureate Intermediate Diploma, NVQ level 2, BTEC First or General Diploma.
step3.educationLevel3Desc: 2 or more A levels, 4 or more AS levels, Higher School Certificate, Welsh Baccalaureate Advanced Diploma, NVQ level 3, BTEC National.
step3.educationLevel4Desc: Degree (BA, BSc), higher degree (MA, PhD, PGCE), NVQ level 4 to 5, BTEC Higher level professional qualifications (for example, teaching, nursing, accountancy).
step3.educationApprenticeshipDesc: Apprenticeship, vocational or work-related qualifications, other qualifications.

step4.title: Data Consent
step4.dataConsent:
I consent to the use of my data as described
on this page, and in more detail in our privacy policy.
step4.futureEvents:
Please also inform me of similar events in the future
(do not delete my details after this event).
step4.dataSharing1: We will share all your contact, attitudinal and demographic details with Thinks, the organisation running this event, and they will make a separate data agreement with you if you are selected to take part.
step4.dataSharing2: Your data will be kept strictly confidential. We will delete your details within one year of the completion of the event, unless you tell us otherwise below. Please read our Privacy Policy for more details.
step4.dataSharing3: At any time, you can withdraw your consent and ask us to delete your data, or request a copy of it, by emailing privacy@sortitionfoundation.org.
step4.dataSharing4: If you ask us to delete your data, we will tell the other organisation(s) listed above to do the same.

step5.title: Information
step5.eventInfo1: The conversation will be held on Saturday 30 November in Ipswich.
step5.eventInfo2: In the week prior to the in-person discussions you will also be invited to take part in a 2-hour online workshop. These will be held in the evening from 6pm ‚Äì 8pm.
step5.eventInfo3: You will be able to choose the evening you attend.
step5.eventInfo4: All participants will receive ¬£175 as a thank you for your time. If there is anything we can do to help you to take part, we will be happy to discuss this with you.
step5.eventInfo5: We can look into options if you do not have a video device or an internet connection - please register for the event whatever your situation, and someone will be in touch if you are selected to take part.

header.title: You have been randomly selected to help shape the future of NHS.
header.subtitle: This form will take less than 3 minutes. All selected participants will receive ¬£175.

contact.info: Please call our Freephone number 0800 009 6486 (8am‚Äì8pm every day) if you need help registering or have other questions. You can also email questions to nhs@sortitionfoundation.org.

banner.register: Click to Register. All selected participants will receive ¬£175.
